abstract: Advanced Micro Devices plans to announce Tuesday that it will split into two companies – one focused on designing microprocessors and the other on the costly business of manufacturing them – in a drastic effort to maintain its position as the only real rival to Intel, according to The New York Times’s Ashlee Vance.
lead_paragraph: Advanced Micro Devices plans to announce Tuesday that it will split into two companies – one focused on designing microprocessors and the other on the costly business of manufacturing them – in a drastic effort to maintain its position as the only real rival to Intel, according to The New York Times’s Ashlee Vance.

headline.main: A.M.D. to Split Into Two Operations
